intro: Epidendrum marciae, commonly known as the Marcia's orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central America. It features pendulous inflorescences with showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has strap-like,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining potting media to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
